newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products quiet due to holiday, most steady.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products quiet due to holiday, most steady.

text.p: NWE oil products were thinly traded on Thursday due to European public holidays, traders said.

Gasoline recovered from early softer levels after NYMEX rallied in the early afternoon. Weaker forward sentiment, with minimal product seen moving trans-Atlantic, was seen in a narrowing May/June contango, down to 50 cents from $1.50.
Naphtha held steady at lower levels in late trade.

No fuel oil barges were seen traded. Low sulphur cracked was boosted by stronger U.S. and Asian prices and a scarcity of prompt material but no deals were heard done. Gas oil gained $1.50 with futures amid steady premiums. -- +44 171 542 8980
